title: 'When country's leader himself bats on the front foot': Surya on PM Modi's Op Sindoor post
content: India secured their ninth Asia Cup title by defeating Pakistan, prompting Prime Minister Modi's congratulatory message referencing Operation Sindoor. Captain Suryakumar Yadav praised Modi's support but downplayed an unusual trophy presentation where the team didn't receive the cup from the PCB Chairman. India also notably refused to shake hands with Pakistan following a terror attack.

title: Kurur stampede: NDA forms 8-member fact-finding team; Hema Malini to lead delegation
content: The BJP constituted an 8-member delegation, led by Hema Malini, to visit Karur, Tamil Nadu, following a deadly stampede at a TVK rally that killed 41 people due to overcrowding. The delegation will investigate the incident's circumstances, meet affected families, and submit a report on the tragedy.

title: Asia Cup final: Trophy drama, Virat Kohli chants, and post-match chaos – full timeline
content: The Asia Cup 2025 final between India and Pakistan was marred by unprecedented controversy. India refused the trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, who then walked off with it. Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha also threw away the runners-up cheque, making it a chaotic and unforgettable night.

title: Prashant Kishore's explosive claim: Big 'murder' charge on deputy CM Samrat Choudhary
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor accused Bihar deputy CM Samrat Choudhary of involvement in a 1995 murder case, alleging he used forged documents to claim minority status. Kishor demanded Choudhary's immediate arrest and removal from office, highlighting a contradiction in his age declarations. He threatened legal action if authorities fail to intervene.

title: Accenture layoffs: 11,000 cut; CEO Julie Sweet says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
content: Accenture has laid off over 11,000 employees in the past three months, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: 'Oye Raju da munda': Shubman Gill turns cheerleader for friend Abhishek Sharma - Watch
content: Abhishek Sharma was crowned Player of the Tournament at the Men’s T20 Asia Cup 2025, driving India to their title triumph against Pakistan. The opener amassed 314 runs in seven matches at a blazing strike rate of 200, consistently providing explosive starts. His impactful performances earned him a brand-new car and widespread acclaim, with teammate Shubman Gill celebrating his success.

title: Why Kash Patel's handshake with Pak Army Chief infuriated desis
content: President Donald Trump hosted Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Field Marshal Asim Munir at the White House last week. Among the senior American officials present was FBI Director Kash Patel. While Trump’s hospitality for Pakistan’s leadership was expected, the image of Patel — Indian-origin, Hindu, and a vocal defender of the Ram Mandir — warmly greeting Munir struck a raw nerve. The photo went viral, spawning accusations of betrayal, opportunism, and hypocrisy.

title: Watch: Moment Mohsin Naqvi stormed out of Asia Cup final ceremony
content: India secured the 2025 Asia Cup title defeating Pakistan. A controversy unfolded during the post-match ceremony. ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi walked off the ground following which the trophy was also removed. The Indian team refused to receive them from his hands. India requested a neutral official for the presentation. The BCCI plans to lodge a formal protest.

title: 'Clog The Toilet': What is the 'airline operation' that targeted Indian H-1B visa holders
content: US President Trump's announced H-1B visa fee hike caused panic among Indian tech workers. An online campaign, "Operation Clog the Toilet," then disrupted flight bookings for those returning, leading to significant financial strain. The White House later clarified the $100,000 fee applied only to new applications, not existing visa holders re-entering the country.

title: 'Outlook stable': Moody's retains India credit rating at 'Baa3'; here's what it said
content: Moody's retained India's Baa3 rating with a stable outlook, citing a robust economy and strong external standing despite US tariffs. The stable outlook and rating confirmation indicate India's continuing credit advantages.

title: Taylor Swift’s dad shines at Chiefs vs Ravens while repping Travis Kelce’s brand
content: Taylor Swift's father, Scott Swift, captured attention by proudly wearing Travis Kelce’s Tru Kolors hat during the Kansas City Chiefs' 37-20 victory over the Baltimore Ravens, signaling strong family support. Taylor herself made a discreet return to Arrowhead after attending Selena Gomez's wedding, quietly supporting Kelce while avoiding the spotlight. This commanding win marked a significant turnaround for the Chiefs.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump's order
content: President Trump's significant H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a stir, prompting Canada to consider attracting highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts view this as a "wonderful opportunity" to draw talent left stranded by the US policy, despite potential challenges within Canada's immigration system.

title: How Mohsin Naqvi's actions added to India vs Pakistan controversies in Asia Cup
content: ACC President Mohsin Naqvi ignited a major controversy after the Indian team refused to accept the Asia Cup trophy from him, citing his anti-India stance. Naqvi subsequently left with the trophy, denying India their traditional celebration. This incident follows his provocative social media posts and PCB's earlier threats to withdraw from the tournament, escalating tensions.

title: Dubai’s richest man has $17.1 bn net worth - He’s not a Sheikh or Prince
content: Pavel Durov, the Russian-born tech entrepreneur behind Telegram, is Dubai's richest man with a $17.1 billion net worth. He settled in Dubai for its tax-friendly policies after leaving Russia over data privacy. Recently, Durov accused French intelligence of pressuring him to censor Moldovan channels, adding to his controversial public image amidst ongoing legal issues in France.

title: UAE just launched 4 new visit visas for AI, cruise, events, and entertainment
content: The UAE introduced new visa categories on September 29, 2025, to attract global talent and support vulnerable groups. Specialized visas for AI professionals, cruise industry workers, event participants, and entertainment specialists aim to boost key sectors. Additionally, humanitarian residency permits now offer stability for foreign widows and divorcees of UAE nationals.

title: Top 10 countries of birth for approved H-1B visas in FY 2024, India leading
content: In Fiscal Year 2024, the H-1B visa program approved nearly 400,000 petitions, with India overwhelmingly dominating as the source country, accounting for 71% of beneficiaries. China followed with 11.7%, while other nations like the Philippines, Canada, and South Korea contributed smaller percentages. This highlights India's significant role in supplying skilled professionals to the US workforce.

title: 'Victims are our brothers, sisters': Stalin condoles Karur deaths; cautions against rumours
content: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin announced a one-member inquiry commission, led by former judge Arunachalam Jagadeesan, into the Karur stampede that claimed 41 lives. He disbursed Rs 10 lakh to each bereaved family and urged against social media rumours. Stalin stressed collective responsibility to prevent future tragedies, prioritizing human lives, and plans to frame rules for events.

title: Karur tragedy: Stampede 'engineered' by police & DMK's Senthil Balaji, says TVK
content: TVK General Secretary Aadhav Arjuna moved the Madras High Court, seeking a CBI probe into the Karur stampede during Vijay's rally. He alleged police and ruling DMK members engineered the incident through electricity disruptions and inadequate arrangements. The petition, which also sought to allow visits to victims' families, was subsequently refused by the high court registry.

title: Manipur unrest fallout: Displaced boy ends life at Jiribam camp
content: A 13-year-old boy, displaced by Manipur's ethnic violence, died by suicide at a Jiribam relief camp, renewing grave concerns for internally displaced persons. This incident brings the reported IDP suicides to at least six since May 2023, underscoring the severe mental health crisis. Authorities have initiated an investigation into the tragic death.

title: 'I am Baramati’s best MLA but Saheb’s record unmatched'; Ajit hails uncle Sharad Pawar
content: Deputy CM Ajit Pawar reflected on his political journey, acknowledging comparisons to Sharad Pawar while highlighting his own dedication as Baramati MLA. He sternly directed police to implement MCOCA against goons at the APMC market, irrespective of their political ties, condemning criminal behaviour. Pawar further rejected attempts to communalize incidents, advocating for secular values and unity.

title: 'Champion team denied trophy': How PCB's Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup silverware
content: India’s Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan turned chaotic off the field, with PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi reportedly taking the trophy and medals after the Indian team refused to receive them from him. The Indian players celebrated with an imaginary trophy, while Suryakumar Yadav and Abhishek Sharma publicly criticised the ACC in the post-match press conference.

title: Moldova elections: Zelenskyy hails Maia Sandu's victory; calls out Russia's 'destabilising activity'
content: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy hailed the pro-European Union party's victory in Moldova's election, asserting that Russian destabilizing efforts and disinformation failed. President Maia Sandu's party secured over 50% of the vote, a crucial outcome for the nation's EU integration push. This result demonstrates Moldova's successful defense against external threats.

title: Silver price today: White metal hits lifetime high; here's what's driving the rally
content: Gold and silver prices soared to lifetime highs in the domestic futures market, mirroring a robust international rally. This surge is primarily driven by growing expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts and a weakening dollar, significantly boosting demand for precious metals. Ongoing geopolitical tensions, including trade disputes and conflicts, are also contributing factors.

title: UP cleric rapes, impregnates 14-year-old madrassa student; held
content: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly repeatedly raped and impregnated by a 32-year-old cleric inside a Saharanpur madrassa over several months. The horrific abuse surfaced when she complained of abdominal pain. Police have arrested the accused, who reportedly threatened the victim. Authorities are now investigating his family's involvement and questioning other students, with the cleric's brother currently absconding.

title: Man shoots teen daughter over inter-caste love; dumps body in tarpaulin bag in river
content: A man was arrested in Morena for allegedly killing his 17-year-old daughter. He reportedly opposed her marriage outside their caste. Police found the body in a river after a neighbour's tip-off. Separately, the Karnataka High Court denied bail to a rape accused. The court cited Manusmriti and Mahatma Gandhi in its decision.

title: Delhi molestation case: 'Godman' Chaitanyananda taken to Sri Sharda Institute, quizzed
content: Delhi Police questioned Chaitanyananda Saraswati regarding sexual harassment allegations at Sri Sharda Institute, following his five-day custody. Investigators found fake UN and BRICS visiting cards, alongside electronic devices. His lawyer alleged a "huge conspiracy" involving prominent individuals, while Saraswati faces accusations of misconduct against female students.

title: SpaceX Falcon 9 stuns Arizona sky like a comet, deploying 28 Starlink satellites
content: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launched from Vandenberg Space Force Base. It carried 28 Starlink satellites into orbit. The launch lit up the Arizona sky. Many residents saw a bright streaking light. The first-stage booster completed its 28th flight. It landed on the drone ship. These satellites expand internet access to remote areas.

title: 'This will haunt them': Shoaib says India will regret not taking Asia Cup trophy
content: Former Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik criticised the Indian cricket team for refusing the Asia Cup trophy after their victory. India objected to receiving it from ACC chief and PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi, who is also a minister in Pakistan, due to his controversial social media posts. Malik warned of future regret for the players, despite captain Suryakumar Yadav valuing his team over the trophy.

title: Karur stampede: Did TVK request power cut during Vijay’s speech?
content: A stampede at TVK leader Vijay's rally in Karur tragically claimed 41 lives, including 18 women and 10 children. The TNEB clarified that power supply remained on, with the chaos stemming from generator failure and a falling tree. Vijay announced financial aid for the bereaved families and injured, expressing profound grief.

title: S&P Global warns! Taking out Russia oil would turn things ‘upside down’
content: S&P Global forecasts oil prices dropping to $55-60 a barrel next year, though removing Russian oil could fundamentally alter market dynamics. Surprisingly, high US tariffs are driving nations towards self-sufficiency, shifting investment decisions beyond cost.

title: Man roped in teen son to kill property dealer over 9-yr feud
content: A father-son duo was arrested for the murder of 56-year-old property dealer Lakhpat Singh Kataria in Malviya Nagar, culminating a decade-long vendetta. The 47-year-old father allegedly involved his 17-year-old son, timing the crime a day before his 18th birthday to exploit juvenile laws.

title: Mohsin Naqvi drags war into cricket in reply to PM Modi’s Asia Cup tweet
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 victory was marred by ACC President Mohsin Naqvi's refusal to present the trophy, leading to a protracted standoff. India declined to accept from him, and Naqvi blocked alternative presenters. The controversy escalated with Naqvi's politicised tweet to PM Modi, drawing widespread condemnation for disrespecting the sport and champions.

title: How autopsy mafia freed killers, framed innocent for Rs 50k in UP
content: Police in UP's Sambhal have uncovered an "autopsy mafia" involving doctors, pharmacists, and morgue staff. This network allegedly altered or erased postmortem reports for Rs 50,000 to shield murder accused or frame innocents, often by removing signs of struggle or changing causes of death. Four individuals have been arrested, and 31 illegal health facilities sealed as investigations continue.

title: Strong legs and longevity: 5 ways to train your legs to become steel strong
content: Strong legs are key to a long, healthy life. Greater thigh muscle mass reduces premature death risk. Powerful legs support mobility and prevent falls. They also boost circulation, benefiting heart and brain health. Simple exercises like squats and walking build strength. Consistency in training ensures lasting benefits. This approach helps maintain independence and sharp thinking as people age.

title: Tata Capital's Rs 15.5k cr IPO: Values firm at Rs 1.38 lakh cr; largest from the group
content: Tata Capital's record-breaking Rs 15,511 crore IPO, the largest from the Tata group and any NBFC, opens on October 6. Valuing the company between Rs 1.31 lakh crore and Rs 1.38 lakh crore, the issue offers shares at Rs 310-326 each.

title: BCCI sends strong warning to PCB after Asia Cup 2025 trophy drama in Dubai
content: India's Asia Cup triumph over Pakistan was overshadowed by unprecedented drama as ACC president Mohsin Naqvi allegedly walked away with the winners' trophy. BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed India refused to accept the silverware from him, announcing a ₹21 crore cash reward for the team and vowing a strong protest at the upcoming ICC conference.

title: ‘Groundless govt’: Ex-Nepal PM Oli missing from spotlight — Will he flee? His response
content: Nepal's former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli has publicly dismissed speculation of him leaving the country, accusing the Sushila Karki-led government of attempting to strip his security and entitlements. Oli, whose administration fell after Gen Z protests, challenged the current government's legitimacy and raised concerns over his safety and alleged plans to withhold leaders' passports.

title: India clinches 9th Asia Cup title: Celebrations rock Jammu & Poonch streets
content: India clinched their record ninth Asia Cup title by defeating Pakistan, sparking widespread celebrations in Jammu & Kashmir. However, the victory was overshadowed by unprecedented drama as the Indian team refused to accept the trophy from ACC president Mohsin Naqvi, citing his controversial remarks and ongoing hostilities, leading to a trophy-less presentation.

title: Karur stampede: Vijay moves HC; two-year-old among 41 killed
content: A stampede at actor-politician Vijay's Karur rally tragically claimed 41 lives, including children and women, and injured over 60. Vijay alleged a "political conspiracy" and sought a CBI probe, while announcing compensation. Chief Minister Stalin visited, assuring support as police registered a negligence case against Vijay's party. Survivors cited delayed arrival, poor crowd management, and a power outage as causes.

title: 'Best Oval Office ever': Trump hails 24-Karat gold revamp
content: Donald Trump praised the 24-karat gold in the Oval Office and Cabinet Room, calling it the "best ever" and noting foreign leaders' awe. He personally purchased and expanded the gold decor, adding trim, cherubim, and trophies. His "gold guy" replicated Mar-a-Lago's gilded style, leading to a "golden office for the golden age."

title: Rs 2.7 lakh cr order book: HAL restructuring on cards; eye on speeding up deliveries
content: The government is evaluating a significant restructuring of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) to enhance operational effectiveness and expedite defence deliveries. This initiative stems from HAL's substantial ₹2.7 lakh crore order backlog, which has led to efficiency concerns and delays in crucial projects like the Light Combat Aircraft.

title: Gold price prediction: Rate outlook for this week; why Rs 1,13,500 is crucial level?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are poised for continued gains, with experts advising a 'buy on dips' strategy for gold. The surge is fueled by strong safe-haven demand, firm Federal Reserve rate cut expectations, and geopolitical tensions.

title: Watch: Karur stampede: family of youngest victim speaks out
content: A tragic stampede at actor Vijay’s TVK rally in Karur claimed over 40 lives, including the youngest victim, Thuruvishnu, a 1-year-10-month-old toddler. His grieving family recalls the chaos, overcrowding, and power outage that made rescue impossible.

title: NDA delegation to look into Karur stampede tragedy
content: Constituted by BJP chief J.P. Nadda, the delegation will look into the circumstances that led to the incident, meet with families, and submit a report

title: Officials in Mandya questioned about lack of water in lakes despite KRS reservoir filled to capacity
content: Some lakes remain unfilled despite KRS reservoir being full, says district in-charge secretary Manoj Kumar Meena

title: Kerala govt plans scheme with Kerala Bank for timely paddy procurement payments
content: Minister G.R. Anil tells Kerala Assembly that this was decided at a meeting called by Chief Minister, along with Food, Agriculture, Power and Cooperation Ministers

title: Karur stampede: a package on the tragedy at Vijay’s TVK rally in Tamil Nadu
content: A compilation of The Hindu’s coverage on the stampede that occurred on September 27, 2025 killing at least 41 fans and supporters of leading Tamil actor and president of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam Vijay at Karur in Tamil Nadu

title: Chief Minister to inaugurate A. Ramachandran Museum in Kollam on October 5
content: It will showcase the artist’s complete body of work, including paintings, sculptures, ceramics, stamp designs, and children’s books

title: Protest against 'I Love Muhammad' graffiti on road turns violent in Ahilyanagar; one arrested
content: At least 30 persons have been detained in connection with the protests, road blockade and stone pelting, Ahilyanagar Superintendent of Police Somnath Gharge said

title: Govt proposes sound alert system for all electric vehicles from October 2027
content: This is a a safety feature in EVs to emit an artificial sound to alert pedestrians and other road users about their presence

title: Bihar Deputy CM lied before Supreme Court to escape trial in murder case, alleges Prashant Kishor
content: Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor accuses Bihar Deputy CM of escaping trial in murder case, demands immediate dismissal

title: India-Bhutan rail links costing ₹4,033 crore announced
content: The Minister said that the 89 km rail links will provide Bhutan access to 1,50,000 kms of Indian railway network

title: Imperative that youth embrace, adapt to advanced technological skills: President Murmu
content: Addressing the probationers of the Indian Skill Development Service (ISDS), Droupadi Murmu said skill and knowledge are the true engines of economic growth and social progress for any nation

title: Ayodhya verdict relied on legal principles of possession, not on “desecration” view
content: Former CJI D.Y. Chandrachud suggested the mosque’s erection was a desecration, a stance that does not appear in the 2019 verdict he co-authored

title: Kerala BJP leader booked for ‘death threat’ remark against Rahul Gandhi
content: Case registered against Printu Mahadevan for his alleged remark during a television debate that bullets would be fired at Rahul Gandhi, say officials

title: Namakkal police register case against TVK general secretary ‘Bussy’ Anand and other functionaries
content: They were booked for various violations, including defying police orders, during the party rally addressed by its president Vijay in Namakkal on September 27

title: Repair of national highways in Tripura to be undertaken on war footing after monsoon: CM
content: National Highways in the State will be repaired on a war footing as soon as the monsoon retreats fully, said C.M. Manik Saha

title: Kerala govt to honour Mohanlal on being conferred with Dadasaheb Phalke Award with mega event
content: Titled ‘Malayalam Vaanolam, Lal Salam’, the event will be held at Central Stadium in Thiruvananthapuram on October 4 evening

title: Durga Puja in Kolkata highlights plight of acid attack survivors
content: West Bengal recorded the highest number of acid attack cases in the country according to the latest available NCRB data

title: Assam govt urges MHA to invoke Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty with Singapore over Zubeen death
content: Two Assam Police officers are likely to visit Singapore soon after the completion of necessary formalities

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur, arms and ammunition seized
content: Security forces seized a huge cache of arms and ammunition during an operation at Sangaithel Longa Koireng Crossing in Imphal, said police

title: Palestine Ambassador Abdullah Abu Shawesh calls on Kerala CM
content: According to a release by CMO, Pinarayi Vijayan expresses solidarity with Palestinian cause for a separate and sovereign State headquartered in East Jerusalem as per 1947 UN resolution

title: Tiger sighting at village in Kerala’s Kannur sparks fear among residents
content: Local residents have limited outdoor movement and children have stayed away from school amid reports of the animal’s presence

title: Katti family retains power cooperative in Hukkeri taluk of Belagavi district in Karnataka
content: The elections on September 28 were the culmination of a bitterly-fought contest between one panel led by the Katti family and another by Anna Saheb Jolle in alliance with the Jarkiholi brothers

title: A Durga Puja pandal in Kolkata that is celebrating the coconut
content: More than 2,000 discarded coconut shells have been used in the decoration of this pandal, located in the neighbourhood of Topsia, in Kolkata

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 12 Indian fishermen from Karaikal, T.N.
content: Sources in the Fisheries Department in Karaikal said the 12 fishermen ventured into the sea on board a mechanised boat from the Karaikal fishing harbour in the early hours of September 25

title: Those losing ideological battle hatching ‘conspiracy’ to silence Rahul Gandhi: Congress slams BJP-RSS
content: The Opposition party has flagged what it termed a “chilling and heinous” death threat to Rahul Gandhi by Printu Mahadev, a former State president of the ABVP, the student wing of the RSS

title: Nirmala Sitharaman, L. Murugan visit Karur stampede site, meet victims’ families
content: They visited the Karur Government Medical College Hospital to enquire about the condition of those undergoing treatment for injuries sustained in the incident

title: Krishna and Godavari Rivers in spate; flood warnings continue in Andhra
content: To strengthen relief measures, two NDRF teams and three SDRF teams have been deployed in vulnerable areas

title: Sabarimala ‘theft’ row: Kerala Devaswom Minister alleges conspiracy
content: Vasavan says circumstances surrounding the recovery of objects from the house of the person who ‘donated’ it to the temple are ‘mystifying’ and warrant a criminal investigation

title: UST in partnership with Kaynes to invest ₹3,330 crore for semiconductor manufacturing unit in Gujarat
content: “This will be an Outsourced Semiconductor Assembly and Test facility scheduled to come up at Sanand,” said UST in a statement

title: Cancel Dussehra rally, redirect funds for flood victims: BJP to Uddhav Thackeray
content: When Mr. Thackeray was the State's Chief Minister, he "failed to act and remained at home", Mr. Upadhye alleged, adding that this is the time to "atone"

title: AIMIM to kickstart its poll campaigning in Maharashtra from September 29
content: Kolhpaur’s Hindutva organisations oppose Asaduddin Owaisi’s programme, give a memorandum to the police saying it will disturb peace during Navratri

title: Kochi NIA court sentences two Coimbatore natives in IS recruitment case
content: Mohammed Azarudeen and Sheik Hidayatullah get eight years of rigorous imprisonment in Kerala-Tamil Nadu Islamic State recruitment case. NIA special court finds the two guilty of recruiting and propagating ideology of IS

title: Five killed in collision between two cars in Kurukshetra
content: The accident occurred around 7 am near Ghararsi village and is believed to have been caused by over speeding, said police

title: Greater flamingos linger in Nemmeli salt pans
content: Experts say the continued presence of flamingos, even outside the usual season, signals that the site holds ecological value

title: Mysuru Dasara: Display of tiger using 2,983 drones has set Guinness record, says CESC
content: CESC had carried out groundwork to ensure that this year’s illumination of streets and junctions of Mysuru as well as the drone show would contribute to a ‘memorable’ experience, says Managing Director Munigopal Raju

title: ‘Hi-tech cheating’ in Kerala PSC exam: Accomplice arrested in Kannur
content: Police say further investigation is on to identify possible external links that facilitated cheating attempt

title: Congress demands special session of Maharashtra legislature to address rain crisis
content: Vijay Wadettiwar wrote a letter to Governor Acharya Devvrat, drawing his attention to the severe emergency situation prevailing in several parts of Marathwada, Vidarbha and western Maharashtra

title: Kerala Assembly expresses concern over SIR, passes unanimous resolution
content: Kerala Legislative Assembly asks Election Commission of India to desist from actions that can ‘potentially harm people’s rights’

title: 18-month-old 'sold' for ₹45,000 rescued from Uttar Pradesh, five arrested
content: The child was rescued from Mahoba in Uttar Pradesh. Among the arrested is a 54-year-old man, a father of two daughters, who took the toddler after offering money to the accused as he did not have a male child

title: Centre failed to honour its own commitments on Statehood to Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh: Omar Abdullah
content: Omar Abdullah also criticised the sudden shift in the stance towards Ladakhi leaders, especially climate activist Sonam Wangchuk

title: Congress cheated Ambedkar of electoral victory: BJP leader Dinesh Sharma
content: Congress defeated B.R. Ambedkar by indulging in dacoity of votes in the elections, Dinesh Sharma said.

title: Amit Shah banking on ‘vote chori’, ‘vote revdi’ in Bihar, such machinations will be defeated, says Congress
content: The Indian National Congress asserted that the politically conscious people of Bihar will defeat these “machinations”

title: Mumbai rains: ‘Orange’ alert in place; light to moderate showers in city
content: In the weather forecast issued at 8 a.m. on Monday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted a "cloudy sky with heavy rainfall" in the city and suburbs. It also forecast the possibility of "very heavy rainfall" at isolated places

title: NCLAT reserves order on Meta, WhatsApp petitions on data-sharing
content: The appellate tribunal NCLAT has completed hearing and reserved its order on the appeals filed by Meta Platforms and WhatsApp

title: Karnataka rain: Minister Eshwar Khandre assures swift relief, crop compensation for Bidar district
content: The Minister along with his colleague Rahim Khan met Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah seeking a special package for the flood-hit district

title: World Food India attracts ₹1.02 lakh crore in food processing sector by global, domestic giants
content: Three Coca-Cola bottlers in India will jointly invest ₹25,760 crore ($2.96 billion) to expand the country's food processing infrastructure and have signed memoranda of understanding with the Ministry for greenfield and brownfield projects.

title: X to appeal Karnataka High Court judgement upholding Sahyog portal
content: The portal allows State police to send takedown orders to social media platforms, which X insists is an illegal censorship regime

title: Former BDA employee among three arrested for forging documents to grab site in Bengaluru
content: According to the police, the accused tried to grab the site of a person who died before he could claim the property allotted to him

title: JMM MLA accused of using fake identity in polling, Jharkhand CEO orders probe
content: The legislator dismissed the charge, claiming that the complainant has the habit of making such allegations against those in power

title: TVK Karur rally stampede: Rahul Gandhi speaks with actor Vijay
content: The death toll in the September 27 stampede at a political rally led by actor-politician Vijay in Karur climbed to 41

title: Zubeen Garg: The atheist who became god
content: The death of Assamese cultural icon Zubeen Garg in Singapore has hit Assam like the tempest of one of his most popular songs. What followed has been a human storm, with thousands of his fans across ages, yearning to see his body for the last time, going to Sonapur near Guwahati for his cremation. As the grief ebbs, anger has taken over, and people bay for the blood of those they feel are responsible for his death, report Sandeep Phukan and Rahul Karmakar

title: Analysing Indian States’ macro-fiscal health
content: In the 2010s, States were able to prosper economically through reforms, better tax collection, and booming growth. Some States even reported surpluses. But the pandemic was a turning point — tax revenues shrank while emergency spending soared, pushing almost every State back

title: Spice Route Initiative to string together ancient ports and heritage sites in Kerala
content: The Muziris Projects Limited has introduced a unique project — the Spice Route Initiative — under which a range of initiatives and programmes have been planned

title: ‘Clog the toilet’ trolls hit Indian visa holders rushing to U.S.
content: Racially motivated far-right trolls launched coordinated efforts to disrupt flight bookings from India after Trump announced the new H-1B visa fee

title: Fire breaks out at Tiruvannamalai GH
content: Based on an alert, a six-member firefighters team and Tiruvannamalai East police personnel rushed to the spot.

title: 92% UGD work completed in Vellore, says Corporation Commissioner
content: Corporation Commissioner R. Lakshmanan told The Hindu that completion of ongoing pipeline-carrying bridge across Palar river, pipe-laying work in at least five streets in Old Town area, and construction of a new pumping station at Vasanthapuram behind the fort complex are remaining works as part of the UGD system.

title: CMC organises cookery competition in Vellore to mark World Diabetes Day
content: Welcoming the gathering, Ms. Agarwal said that the importance of inculcating healthy habits right from childhood is required.

title: Will donate my Asia Cup match fee to Armed Forces and Pahalgam victims: Suryakumar Yadav
content: “I have never seen this before, winning team not receiving trophy,” said Suryakumar Yadav on Indian team not being presented Asia Cup; India defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the final to win the trophy

title: 7-year-old Class 2 student hung upside down by school bus driver in Panipat over ‘misbehaviour’; FIR filed
content: The incident that took place over a month ago came to light when the boy’s mother stumbled upon the video on Instagram on Saturday

title: Tea garden workers protest over bonus; management releases first instalment
content: Workers of Nagaisuri Tea garden held protests on September 26 and 27 and called off their agitation after there was an assurance by the management to provide bonus in three instalments

title: PM Modi meets Vice President Radhakrishnan
content: "Hon'ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi met with Hon'ble Vice-President Shri C P Radhakrishnan at the Vice-President's Enclave today," the Vice President's secretariat said on X.

title: Government aims to integrate Ayurveda into health education curriculum in schools, colleges: Minister
content: Discussions are underway with NCERT and UGC for preparing course modules for the school education and higher education, says Prataprao Jadhav

title: BCCI to lodge protest against Naqvi after Asia Cup trophy presentation fiasco
content: “We came along with the medals, so it is very unfortunate, very unsporting and we hope that the trophy and the medals will be returned to India as soon as possible”, said Devajit Saikia, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) secretary.

title: Durga Puja revellers flock early to pandals in West Bengal fearing rain
content: Durga Puja festivities will peak over the next four days of Saptami, Ashtami, Navami, and Dashami; large crowds were seen in Kolkata, its suburbs, and in the districts across West Bengal on Sasthi, the sixth day of the festival

title: There is still room for talks with Maoists: Chhattisgarh CM Vishnu Deo Sai
content: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister says the double-engine government has played a significant role in the fight against Maoists in the State; he says tourism is a focus area in Bastar because of its natural beauty, and agriculture and dairy will be promoted because tribal communities have a particular interest in farming; the State has received investment proposals worth ₹7 lakh crore in just 10 months, he adds

title: Asia Cup trophy not awarded to champions India after they refuse to accept it from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi
content: Once Mohsin Naqvi took the dais, he was informed that Indian team won't accept the trophy if he tries to force himself and an official protest would be lodged.

title: Haryana police personnel sustain injuries as mob attacks them during raid in Nuh; 13 held
content: Sixteen people named in the FIR and around 50 unidentified people were part of the mob that attacked the police

title: Concern over rise in accidents on newly built NH 66 stretch
content: Two back-to-back accidents in two days on the stretch result in three fatalities; illegal parking of heavy vehicles, especially lorries, poses safety threat to motorists

title: HC constitutes high-level study group to examine sewerage network in Kochi
content: The panel comprises LSGD Principal Secretary, KSPCB Chairperson, KWA chief, and Corporation Secretary; the court has directed the study group to submit a preliminary report within a month outlining the areas that need attention

title: Operation Sindoor on games field, India wins: PM Modi on Asia Cup final
content: PM Modi said on X, "Operation Sindoor on the games field. Outcome is the same - India wins! Congrats to our cricketers."

title: A horrific night reporting a stampede at Karur
content: Initially, the crowd was sparse, leading one to believe that the turnout would be low. However, the numbers swelled around 4 p.m., after Vijay’s rally in Namakkal. The crowd waited patiently as high-energy songs praising him were being played

title: UGC makes registration on new Study In India portal mandatory for all foreign students
content: UGC has further instructed HEIs onboarding foreign students to appoint a “Compliance Officer” in the institution to ensure compliance of all guidelines under SII programme and portal.

title: Government raising awareness on early diagnosis for heart conditions, says Minister
content: On the eve of World Heart Day, Satya Kumar Yadav claims that around 1.41 lakh people with heart conditions receive free medical treatment worth around ₹996 crore through the NTR Vaidya Seva

title: RJD, Congress to give up seats in favour of allies in Bihar
content: The RJD-led mahagatbandhan is narrowing down on a seat-sharing formula for the upcoming Bihar Assembly polls, where both RJD and Congress have agreed to give up a dozen seats each to accommodate the now expanded coalition

title: Heavy rush in Vijayawada on eve of Moola Nakshatram day, traffic diversions in place
content: Thousands of devotees throng the city for darshan of Goddess Kanaka Durga, leading to traffic snarls at major junctions. Officials announce diversions and no-vehicle zones, with tight security for the Chief Minister’s visit to Indrakeeladri

title: KVPS slams government for ‘humiliating’ Legislative Council Chairman
content: Moshenu Raju has not been invited to the inauguration of the new Assembly building complex as he belonged to the SC community, the KVPS leaders allege

title: Deepavali discount sale begins at Co-optex showroom in Villupuram
content: According to a press release, Co-optex will offer a rebate of 30% on silk and cotton saris sourced from weavers in Coimbatore, Kancheepuram, Salem, Arani, and Tirubhuvanam, among other places.

title: Krishna floods: Officials close bathing ghats, stop devotees from taking bath in river
content: Villagers evacuated from Pata Yadlalanka island at Avanigadda; those staying in the downstream of Krishna asked not to cross the overflowing canals and the river on countrymade boats

title: Jackson injures hamstring as Ravens fall to 1-3
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson sustained a hamstring injury in the third quarter of his team's 37-20 loss to the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium, and Baltimore coach John Harbaugh had no update during his postgame media availability.

title: Parsons leaves Dallas 'disappointed' in defense, tie
content: Micah Parsons got one thing he wanted in his return to AT&T Stadium: He sacked his former QB, Dak Prescott. The rest of it, however, left him unfulfilled after his current team, the Packers, played his former team, the Cowboys, to a 40-40 tie Sunday.

title: Coen, Saleh clash postgame over sign-stealing talk
content: The simmering tension over 49ers DC Robert Saleh's remark about the Jaguars "legally stealing signals" from opponents spilled onto the field Sunday, as Saleh and Jacksonville coach Liam Coen had to be separated amid a heated postgame exchange.

title: Mercury top short-handed Lynx, make WNBA Finals
content: The Phoenix Mercury overcame a 13-point fourth-quarter deficit to defeat the short-handed Minnesota Lynx 86-81 in Game 4 on Sunday to advance to the WNBA Finals for the first time since 2021, and in that round, they'll take on Indiana or Las Vegas.

title: Ryder Cup envelope rule must change, per Bradley
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: Mets fumble final shot at October: 'It's a failure'
content: The Mets, who entered the season with a $322.6 million payroll and huge expectations, completed their monthslong collapse Sunday with a loss to Miami.

title: Rory: Should never accept fans' behavior in N.Y.
content: Rory McIlroy, the target of constant heckling this week at Bethpage Black, called the fans' behavior unacceptable and said Americans should have been supporting their own players, not using that energy to insult the Europeans.

title: USC's Watkins to miss season following ACL tear
content: USC star JuJu Watkins will miss the 2025-26 college basketball season as she continues to recover from a right ACL tear that she suffered in the NCAA tournament.

title: Best, worst of NFL Week 4: Packers tie Cowboys in OT thriller, plus Chiefs win big over Ravens
content: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

title: How Phoenix reached the WNBA Finals, Indiana forced semifinals Game 5
content: Phoenix is headed to the WNBA Finals. The Fever forced the Aces to a Game 5. We break down Sunday's games.

title: The only MLB playoff preview you need: World Series odds, likely MVPs and how far all 12 teams will go
content: Have Fall Classic or bust hopes for the postseason? Here's why your squad could be playing deep into October ... or get sent home early.

title: How Europe was able to back up Rory McIlroy's words and win on the road
content: Two years ago, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Europe's gutsy team play made that prediction come true.

title: 10 moments that define 2025 Mets' epic collapse
content: The Mets nearly won a pennant last year -- and then added Juan Soto. And yet a season of promise turned into an all-time collapse.

title: Oregon in OT? Virginia's stunner? Bama's redemption? Ranking the 25 best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: A raucous Week 5 reshuffled expectations
content: With four top-10 teams losing, Week 5 offered a reminder of just how little we know so early in a season.

title: 'I'm going to get Dan back': Aaron Glenn ready to add to legacy in Jets-Dolphins rivalry
content: The Jets' coach was drafted by the franchise in 1994 and had a role in several key moments and games against the Dolphins.

title: Why a return to Miami means so much for Minkah Fitzpatrick
content: The trade to the Dolphins has allowed the safety to spend time with family, including a budding football star.

title: 'It's best against best': Ja'Marr Chase, Pat Surtain II ready for rare battle of WR, CB elites
content: Chase, the reigning Offensive Player of the Year, and Surtain, the defending DPOY, face off in an epic WR/CB battle.

title: Ranking Week 4 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 4's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Arsenal handle adversity, prove they belong in Premier League title race
content: Arsenal's last-minute 2-1 win over Newcastle United has been yet another demonstration of their Premier League title credentials.

title: Spirit emphatically book postseason berth
content: Washington Spirit's 4-0 win over the Houston Dash has confirmed their playoff position. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Chase Elliott races from eighth to win in two-lap OT at Kansas
content: Chase Elliott drove from eighth to the checkered flag during a two-lap overtime sprint at Kansas Speedway to earn a spot in the third round of NASCAR's playoffs.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Al Horford's deal with Warriors
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What scouts are saying about Drew Allar
content: What is Drew Allar's current draft stock? Which Ohio State prospect stood out the most Saturday? We have updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 5.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Xavi keen on Man United if Amorim departs
content: Xavi would be interested in joining Manchester United if they choose to replace beleaguered boss Ruben Amorim. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Rookie Watch: Demidov and 11 other names you need to know this season
content: Whether in a redraft or dynasty league, here are the rookies you need to know before your fantasy hockey draft.

title: This Ancient Temple In Bihar Practices Rare Bloodless Sacrifice
content: The ancient Maa Mundeshwari Temple in Kaimur district of Bihar is known for its unique tradition of bloodless sacrifice.

title: BJP MP Had Questioned Jan Suraaj's Funding. Prashant Kishor Responds
content: Days after a BJP leader questioned Jan Suraaj's funding, its leader and poll strategist-turned-politician, Prashant Kishor, has shared details and stressed that the party's funding is transparent and clean

title: 'I Love Mohammed' On Rangoli Sparks Tension In Maharashtra, 30 Detained
content: Tension grips Ahilyanagar in Maharashtra after the "I love Mohammed" slogan written in a rangoli on the street sparked communal tension, and a group of protesters clashed with the police

title: Opinion: Opinion | Can India Rescue Its Exiled Coders - Like China And Taiwan?
content: For years, the middle-class mantra in India was: study hard, crack the exams, get the H-1B visa, build a life in America. That promise now lies in ruins. But...China and Taiwan have been here before.

title: Day Before Son's 18th Birthday, Delhi Man Makes Him Murder Property Dealer
content: The police said the 47-year-old accused deliberately carried out the crime just a day before the 18th birthday of his son so he could benefit from the provisions of juvenile law.

title: Bengaluru Man Makes Objectionable Remarks Against Woman Cop, Case Filed
content: Karnataka Police has registered a case against a bike rider for making objectionable remarks on social media against a woman Traffic Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) in Bengaluru.

title: "Want To Know What Happened In His Last Moments": Zubeen Garg's Wife
content: Zubeen Garg's wife, Garima Saikia Garg, on Monday said that the singer's family wants to know what had happened in his last moments that led to his death, and that a proper inquiry should be conducted.

title: Generative AI Might End Up Being Worthless And That Could Be Good Thing
content: Free genAI services, and cheap subscription services like ChatGPT and Gemini, cost a lot of money to run. Right now, however, there are growing questions about just how AI firms are going to make any money.

title: Ladakh Tourism Takes A Hit Amid Violent Protests In Leh
content: Ladakh's tourism sector, already reeling from setbacks earlier this season, has been dealt another blow with the curfew in Leh following last week's violence.

title: Opinion: Opinion| Musk And Gates Were Both Wrong On The Future Of Trucks
content: To hear Bill Gates tell it, the electric drivetrains that have transformed the passenger vehicle industry over the past decade have no chance of repeating the trick in heavy trucks.

title: Kerala Minister Alleges Conspiracy In Missing Gold Artefacts At Sabarimala
content: The political and religious storm surrounding the gold artefacts of the Sabarimala Ayyappa Temple escalated sharply, with the Kerala Devaswom minister alleging a "larger conspiracy" behind the six-year disappearance of a Dwarapalaka idol pedestal.

title: 8 Dead, 17 Missing As Typhoon Bualoi Tears Through Vietnam
content: Seventeen fishermen were missing after huge waves hit two fishing boats off Quang Tri province, while another fishing boat lost contact during the storm, the government's disaster management agency said.

title: Pakistanis Roast Pakistan On YouTube, X After Asia Cup Humiliation
content: As Team India scripted history by clinching their 9th Asia Cup title by defeating Pakistan at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium, emotions ran high across the border, with frustrated reactions of Pakistani fans flooding social media.

title: Centre Failed On Its Commitments On J&K, Ladakh Statehood: Omar Abdullah
content: Omar Abdullah also criticised the sudden shift in the stance towards Ladakhi leaders, especially climate activist Sonam Wangchuk.

title: 'Cricket Fine, Conference Not?' Ladakh Activists Want Sonam Wangchuk Freed
content: Demanding Sonam Wangchuk's immediate release, leaders of the Kargil Democratic Alliance today questioned why the activist was being linked with Pakistan just because he attended a climate change conference in Islamabad

title: Case Against UP Man, Family For Giving Triple Talaq On WhatsApp
content: A man and his family members have been booked here after he illegally pronounced triple talaq to his wife via WhatsApp after harassing her over dowry, officials said on Monday.

title: Trump Flaunts 24-Karat Gold In Oval Office, Says World Leaders "Freak Out"
content: Video shared by President Trump shows gold-coloured wall mouldings that looked ready to be installed in the White House.

title: Karur Stampede: TVK Chief Vijay Holds Video Conference With Senior Leaders
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay on Monday held a video conference with senior leaders from his Pattinapakkam penthouse to discuss the next steps following the Karur stampede, which claimed 41 lives.

title: "In Comatose State": BJP Jabs Congress Over 'Silence' On India's Asia Cup Win
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Monday lashed out at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for not congratulating Team India after its Asia Cup win.

title: Karnataka High Court Denies Bail To Man Accused Of Rape, Cites Manusmriti, Mahatma Gandhi
content: The Karnataka High Court has refused to grant bail to a man accused in a rape case, invoking a verse from Manusmriti pertaining to respecting women and a remark by Mahatma Gandhi.
